Firstly A few words about directions:
If you’re driving, be sure to read the access instructions carefully. The restaurant’s entrance is discreetly tucked away within the Resorts World Sentosa Car Park, which can be a bit tricky to locate if you’re unfamiliar with the area. For those using a ride-hailing service, it’s wise to bring a printed copy of the directions from your confirmation email, I assume many drivers, including ours, weren’t aware of this hidden gem.
As an added perk, the restaurant provides complimentary access to Sentosa Gateway, saving non-residents the usual entry fee.

Secondly once inside, everything unfolded seamlessly. From the moment we arrived, the evening blossomed into a truly delightful experience, The entire team was remarkably attentive and genuinely welcoming. A special shoutout goes to Rona, who orchestrated the evening with effortless grace and precision. From the impeccable timing of each dish to the harmonious pairing of drinks, she ensured that every detail was flawlessly executed.

We chose the dinner menu with wine pairing, and it turned out to be an extraordinary culinary journey. Each course showcased a distinct theme, artfully matched with complementary flavors and textures. The experience began with a delicate Japanese sake accompanying the first course, setting a refined and elegant tone. From there, a well-paced progression of dishes was paired with carefully selected whites, reds, and a luscious dessert wine. Each pairing elevated the flavors, adding depth and nuance that transformed the meal into a beautifully curated tasting adventure.

This captivating experience unfolded over approximately 3.5 hours, and it was worth every minute, an indulgent celebration of taste, timing, and thoughtful presentation.

I ordered the 4 course lunch menu and was blown away by the incredible food, service, and atmosphere.

I can't applaud the staff enough on how professional and friendly they were. I had the lovely May explaining each dish to me and making sure everything was going ok. There was also a group of diners at the table next to me making a lot of noise and crowding the tank to take selfies, so the staff kindly shifted them to the other end of the restaurant to allow me to enjoy observing the fish in the tank in peace - I was blown away by their kindness and consideration!

I was impressed with each course that came out. In addition to the menu items, there were also several complimentary hors d'oeuvres and desserts.

Each dish was expertly cooked, and each ingredient was extremely high quality and treated with utmost respect. As I had arrived at the restaurant just after it opened, I was shown a smoked duck neck the chefs had prepared for one of the hors d'oeuvres, as part of the restaurant's ethos to minimise wastage.

The Hokkaido scallop was large, plump, sweet, and had a buttery texture. The morello mushrooms had an amazing umami flavour and juicy beefy texture, I could have easily eaten a whole bowl of these. The white asparagus was tender and sweet, with no fibrousness at all. The sauces were also packed with flavour and complimented the dish wonderfully. A faultless dish!

The turbot was fall apart tender, as was the cabbage. The sauce also packed a lot of umami flavour which helped bring out the seafood flavour of the fish. The pickled shallots provided an acidity needed to balance the dish, and the tobiko provided some nice crunch as well to contrast the with the softness of the fish and cabbage.

The magret was cooked excellently, the fat had been rendered from the skin and the meat was blushing pink. I really enjoyed the toasted hazelnut garnish on the magret. The grilled orange provided a nice sweetness to combat the bitterness from the endive - which was cooked until it had a lovely soft texture. The only thing I noted was the toasted coriander seeds on top of the magret were a little bit too chunky, but I can imagine it would complement the magret nicely if it was ground down a bit more finely.

The dessert was very nice as well, the passionfruit jelly was very bright on the palette and packed with flavour. The pavlova was crisp and light, and the coconut jelly provided a good creaminess, along with the cream filling of the pavlova. The crispy rice was light and indeed crunchy, and had been coated in caramelised sugar which provided the slight bitterness needed to counteract the sweetness from the rest of the dish. I loved the addition of the lime zest sprinkled over the top of the dish. The only thing I noted was that the flavour of the mango sorbet was a little too subtle.

The complimentary bread was another unexpected highlight. I especially enjoyed the brioche and comte cheese bread. The brioche was crisp on the outside but light, fluffy, and buttery on the outside - i've never had anything like it before! The flavour of the comte cheese bread shone when eaten with the butter and honey.

The hazelnut dessert was also very delicious, the pastry tasted like a choux bun and it had a light chocolate/hazelnut creme filling inside which left a very clean mouthfeel afterwards.

Overall i'm very impressed with this restaurant and hope to come back the next time i'm in Singapore!

Just a note, the entrance of the restaurant can be difficult to find due to it's location in the carpark of the Equarius hotel, but there's a video on their website outlining the directions to find the restaurant :)

The ambience is simply fantastic, food is lovely & presented well.
Room for improvement: Having 1-2 more mains choices would be ideal. At the present, one would have to choose between beef or duck.

The aquarium’s marine life was presented at its finest! Coupled with great smiles and exceptional service from all staff, it made for an unforgettable experience. It would have been even better if we could mute the noise from those who couldn’t speak softly—but of course, that’s out of anyone’s hands. Aside from that, everything else was perfect! It’s rare for me to finish every dish during fine dining, but I thoroughly enjoyed and finished everything served here. Love all fishes!

I thought the combination of chocolate lava tart and caviar would be strange, but it turned out to be a delightful surprise! Kudos to the pastry chef—it was impressive!

I rolled into Ocean Restaurant excited for an eight-course tasting and it was a real rollercoaster.

Food

The seafood all felt par-boiled rather than wok-seared, so if you’re after that big, smoky Asian punch, you might leave a little underwhelmed.

Most of the sauces were spot-on (I’m still dreaming of that miso-ginger), but the pea purée? One taste and my tongue threw in the towel. 😰

Apple crumble dessert: Cute concept, but they cranked the apple flavor so high it drowned out everything else.

Ambience

Mid-meal, it felt like an untightened tap dripped straight onto my wife’s dress—definitely not what you pay for in “elegant dining.” (air con)

A squad of drain flies crashed our party, buzzing around and even landing in the bread basket. Even after they tried to shoo them off, our little guests refused to leave.

Service
Huge props to service staff May for saving the night:

Table Rescue – Spotted the leak and moved us to drier ground.

Dish Hype – Walked us through each course like a personal hype squad.

Photo Assist – Snapped our shots so we didn’t end up looking like lost tourists.

Would I go back?
Maybe—but only if service staff May is on shift, they swap out that pea purée, dial down the apple in the crumble, and banish the flies.

I had the pleasure of dining at Ocean Restaurant at Resort World Sentosa, and it was an unforgettable experience!
The ambiance is both elegant and serene, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that complements the marine theme.
The menu is a culinary journey, showcasing a blend of fresh seafood and innovative flavors. I opted for the six courses menu, which featured beautifully presented dishes. Each course was a delight, bursting with flavor and artistry. Notable highlights included the seared scallops—cooked to perfection.
The service was impeccable; the staff were knowledgeable and attentive, special recognition to Ms. WINNIE LIEW who is always ensuring that every detail of our dining experience was flawless.

Overall, Ocean Restaurant offers not just a meal, but a memorable experience that combines exquisite cuisine with breathtaking views of marine life.

We had an unforgettable dining experience while celebrating our anniversary at Ocean Restaurant.

The ambiance was stunning and opulent, but what truly made our dining experience special was the incredible staff. Rona went above and beyond to make us feel celebrated, and Jackie was attentive, warm, and offered thoughtful recommendations that enhanced our meal. The sommelier, Marcus, and Jessica, were all very friendly. They added personalized touches that made our celebration even more extraordinary. Jessica even arranged our buggy ride and ensured everything went smoothly. The team made sure everything was perfect—kudos to them for their outstanding service!

As a food critic might say, the dishes were not your typical fare but offered a unique and creative twist. The flavors were well-balanced and delicious, making the experience both adventurous and enjoyable.

One of the most magical aspects was dining beside the massive aquarium, filled with fascinating marine life. Watching the graceful movements of the sea creatures while enjoying our meal was truly spectacular—it felt like being immersed in an underwater paradise.

The majestic atmosphere, paired with delicious food and outstanding service, made our anniversary celebration impeccable. We couldn’t have asked for a better one!

We highly recommend Ocean Restaurant for anyone seeking an extraordinary dining experience!

As a seafood lover and aquarium enthusiast, I had been looking forward to this experience after CATCORA more than 10 years ago.

The moment I stepped into the restaurant, I was captivated by the stunning panoramic view of the S.E.A. Aquarium. Watching the marine life swim gracefully while enjoying my meal was truly mesmerizing.

We ordered a 8-course dinner set(288$) with wine pairing(+198).

While the restaurant undoubtedly boasts some of the freshest seafood in Singapore, excessive use of squid ink sauces might not be ideal for a first date.

The deep, inky hue can leave your lips and teeth stained, making it a less-than-romantic affair.
However, if you're willing to overlook the potential cosmetic mishap, the seafood itself is truly exceptional.

The freshness is a testament to the restaurant's commitment to sourcing the finest ingredients and showcasing them in their natural state. It seems the head chef also has some sort of special obsession with the use of foams with it on several dishes.

Service was impeccable. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and made excellent recommendations. He was attentive and ensured that our dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish.

Overall, my dinner at Ocean Restaurant was pleasant. I do recommend it to anyone with a budget to try this place when visiting Singapore or for a special occasion(just not first few dates).

Bought my wife for the anniversary lunch as she is from oversea. Reservation needs to be done at least a few months in advance as according to the serving staff there.

I did it like 3 weeks in advance due to an impromptu request from my wife to celebrate our anniversary. In additional we had also requested for any seat next to the fishes.

The location is a bit hard to find from the carpark to another carpark. And finally found the place.

We were set to a location where there was a super big pillar and yet paying the same pricing as the restaurant customers. The experience wasn't that great despite our advanced information being given to the restaurant. If only this carefully address to.

I think if the restaurant can pay ABIT attention and if the view wasn't available can keep us in the loop as leaving is an options to other restaurants and not with regrets.

Lastly we had to wait till 1 of the family tables had finished their meal then we requested to have our seats changed before the serving of the deserts.

Sincerely hope the restaurant can be upfront to any patron that visiting base on their request availability instead of only on sales on patrons which this is also too important to the revenue of the restaurant.

Truly and amazing experience. Celebrated our anniversary here and so many nice gestures from the chef giving us many complimentary things to feast on!

Our hostess, Jessica, such a loving, attentive and very hospitable the moment we stepped in. We reserved a seat near the aquarium and the view is spectacular!!

We had the 8 course meal. I must say the frog leg doesn’t taste too bad. And the A4 waghyu beef was perfect at medium rare.

I really enjoy my experience here ❤️

I wish I could give 6 stars for Atmosphere! Every time we dine at the Ocean Restaurant I'm amazed at how magical it is. Nothing compares in the land of skybars. New menu was great too... well it's  been awhile since we visited, so new to us. The staff were friendly and attentive too. Thank you.

The food at Ocean Restaurant was nothing short of exceptional. Each dish was a work of art, beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The menu featured a delightful selection of fresh seafood dishes, expertly prepared by the talented chefs. Every bite was a culinary delight, and I found myself savoring each dish with delight.

What truly set Ocean Restaurant apart was the impeccable service provided by the staff. From the knowledgeable servers to the attentive waitstaff, every member of the team went above and beyond to ensure that my dining experience was nothing short of perfect. They were friendly, courteous, and always ready to accommodate any request with a smile.

Awesome dinner to wrap up the family summer vacation before returning to Ishikawa the following morning. The wholesome meal, the pretty desserts, the craft cocktails, the remarkable wines, the therapeutic atmosphere & the goodies takeaways.
Thank you Kevin Man & Team Ocean for your heartfelt hospitality 🙏

Dear Ocean Restaurant Team,

I am writing to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional experience my friends and I had during our recent visit. It was my second time at your restaurant, and I'm thrilled to report that the high standards we experienced during our first visit were not only maintained but exceeded.

A special mention goes to Laura, our server for the evening, who contributed significantly to our delightful experience. Her warm and cheerful demeanor, coupled with a quick sense of humor, added an extra layer of enjoyment to our night. Kudos to Laura for her excellent service!

The standout dish for me this time was the Octopus with chilled corn soup. The flavors were nothing short of extraordinary. The tenderness of the octopus was remarkable, almost as if it were still alive. The chilled corn soup elevated the dish to a whole new level, creating a festive atmosphere that made it feel like Christmas was just around the corner. I must admit, the dish was so delectable that I found myself tempted to abandon etiquette and indulge in licking the plate clean.

I want to extend my gratitude for providing my guests and me with a wonderful and memorable evening. The experience surpassed our expectations and, in the words of my friends, was even better than a short trip. The combination of good food, engaging conversations, and the welcoming environment made our time truly relaxing and pleasing.

I eagerly anticipate my third visit and will be following closely to see what new delights your menu has to offer. Thank you once again for creating such a special and enjoyable atmosphere for us.

We loved every moment of it. The view by the aquarium is the best, the food was on the higher side in pricing but great in quality. Most deserving of praise is the service for sure.

Jeckie our host was impeccable throughout the night, he is such a gem and made the dinner as amazing as it was. Thank you so much for making our night.

Great service and food and atmosphere. It is quite pricey but totally worth it. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The staff went for an extra mile to help us find the place when we were lost. Throughout the meal, we were constantly attended to by staff and constantly amazed by the beauty of the aquarium. We had 8 course meals but were given an extra 2 courses treat by the chef. It was super filling, and overall, I would definitely recommend this place.

Delicious food and awesome service. We had the 8 course dinner set and everything was splendid. Staff were very friendly and attentive, they certainly made the night even sweeter. Not to mention the amazing view

Had a wonderful lunch at Ocean Restaurant with a friend, and I must say the service was absolutely superb. Special thanks to Rona and Bruno for going above and beyond — they were attentive, thoughtful, and made sure our food was served promptly, knowing my friend was on a tight lunch schedule.

The dishes were delicious, beautifully presented, and bursting with flavor. The ambience was equally impressive — dining beside the aquarium made the experience truly unique and relaxing.

Highly recommended for both the food and the unforgettable setting. Will definitely be back!

Everything was good and delicious. The ambience and service were great rendered by the staff. We came to celebrate special moment with family and wanted to bring the kids to experience the fish aquarium.
I understand this is a Michelin star award restaurant but one of our King Crab meal came with traces of shell. Check out my picture. Ta da the shell skin ….
6 courses $250 ++ per pax

Came here for the experience of dining in front of the singapore aquarium. The restaurant is small and the staff genuinely attentive and caring, the food is good enough though not exceptional in my view (I wasn’t disappointed though). My only real problem was the elevator music that really held the immersion back. I would have preferred something instrumental or nothing at all.

Based on the previous reviews, I'd fully expected to only enjoy the view. However, we were pleasantly surprised that the food was actually really good. There were also some surprising elements that just elevated the dishes like the crispy prosciutto sprinkles. Just that the beef was really meh. Should stick to just seafood.
They accommodated our dietary requirements. Service was good. They also called a buggy to send us out where it's easier to get transport back to the mainland. Overall an enjoyable experience with good flavours and textures. Really nice ambience too as it was quiet.

This cozy restaurant has left some impressions! Hospitable hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation, wide wine list and wonderful dessert. We were there for a little more than 3 hours, we selected 8 courses without the wine.

It was a good and enjoyable meal, however towards the end of the meal was a little disappointing, maybe they are getting ready for their closing, is not easy to get hold of the hosts and they didn't gave us the after meal door gift whereby everyone else in the restaurant had one of it. (I'm just curious what is inside)

The dining experience is amazing with all the fishes swimming. The food is innovative but it failed to blow my mind. It was above average. It will be an awesome place for couples. The restaurant was generous in providing complimentary desserts knowing that it’s for a birthday celebration.
I am writing to express my frustration regarding my recent visit to your establishment. The service we received was unacceptable and significantly marred our experience. …

Main draw of this place is indeed the view and the experience. You could keep your kids entertained throughout the meal actually. A great upside.
Staff and service crew were all great.
The food was a mix between Asian Mediterranean styles. Liked the Tom yum soup. The beef and other mains were alright and I didn’t remember getting blown away by any particular dish. Nonetheless, you can try the place out just for the experience.
Came with a friend from Hong Kong. Foods are nice. We opt for 4 course lunch. It comprises quite a lot of food. Couple with a simple drinks. Full after that. We spent about $200 per pax in total.

A little late for the review, but impeccable restaurant with really great food. We were really impressed with the set menu and they gave us quite a number of complimentary dishes which were of high quality as well. Price was reasonable for the fantastic ambience and service was splendid. Will definitely return in the future. Special mention to the caviar chocolate tart which my girlfriend wouldn’t shut up about.

First I want let everyone know in case they also have trouble finding the restaurant!

Directions: We were coming from the aquarium and Google maps was telling us to walk through a construction that was still occurring for the Ocean Restaurant - turns out it was just them working on expanding their large aquarium. What I learn was that you need to be in the Equarius Hotel either by shuttle bus or walking there. Make sure you head to the parking lot because that is where the restaurant is located. You can take the escalator down to there or go through from the parking Lot.

Service: the host and staff were very accommodating and nice! They were going to have someone drive us to the pick up area via golf cart after our meal. They also gave us water and the AC in the restaurant was amazing after running a few miles to get to our reservation.

Food: this was a set menu so only had to make a decision on the appetizer and entree. The food was beautifully put together and every flavor was exploding. The food and the view of all the fishes was a truly unique excitement.

overall: If you want a unique experience and an amazing dining experience. Definitely check this place out if you are in Singapore.

I am writing to express my frustration regarding my recent visit to your establishment. The service we received was unacceptable and significantly marred our experience.

First, the abrupt change to the menu was neither communicated in advance nor handled properly, which left us feeling unprepared and disappointed. Additionally, we were pressured to order items we clearly indicated we could not eat, specifically beef, which felt intrusive and disrespectful.

Furthermore, I noticed a concerning disparity in treatment from the lady I believe to be the manager. Her demeanor toward us was noticeably less respectful than that afforded to other tables, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

Finally, the overall management of the restaurant seems lacking. Our experience this time was inconsistent with the positive visits we've had in the past. While I acknowledge that the service staff were generally okay, this did little to mitigate the overall disappointment.

I hope you take this feedback seriously and address these issues to improve the dining experience for future guests.

Celebrated our 27th wedding anniversary at Ocean Restaurant which is the best decision we ever made. The ambience there was so cozy with fantastic up close aquarium view . Special thanks to Mr Raymond for checking before the meal whether we are allergic to any food as I can't consume any food with liquior content & a big thank you to Mr Marcus for the surprise anniversary dessert which tasted so yummy! Hugs and kisses for all the team members who delivered top notch service with their friendly smile and kind gesture to take photos for us and their lovely wishes to our anniversary really warms my heart . Almost forgot to thank Mr Raymond who gave us 2 beautiful boxes of chocolate before we left. Thank you so much team of Ocean Restaurant for making our anniversary a very memorable one it means alot to us! Highly recommend to anyone who has a special occasion to celebrate with your loved one you won't be disappointed trust me !

Such a lovely dining place! Seems to be short-staffed but understandable because of the covid pandemic. Kudos to the two staffs who have worked hard to make it such a pleasant dining experience, it is unfortunate that I forgot to note down their names. The manager perhaps will be able to find out and pass them our compliment (Dining date: 25 Aug lunch, first seating). My daughter loves the tomato sambal bun very very much, she ate one and half. The crispy prawn, pork belly, and beef tenderloin are good for their price. It was a bit of a rush in the end because there were second seatings for lunch. I think more staffs are needed or perhaps need to push the first seating to an earlier time.

It was bit tricky to find the restaurant, we did took awhile, asked around, someone super friendly took us there.

Couldn’t thank the whole team enough for such a great dining experience~

Highly recommended this restaurant!
Very knowledgeable sommelier, friendly staff, fantastic food, bubbly but also relaxing atmosphere. We really enjoyed everything, it was impeccable, and would definitely visit this restaurant again, hopefully soon!!!

Had a pleasant dinner experience celebrating a birthday, the staff were attentive and the food came very fast. Would recommend abit more time in between courses (had to inform our waiter to pause on the main courses)

It was a beautiful experience dining with a view of the aquarium. However, I had called in weeks before to inform the staff that it was a birthday celebration, noted that we would have to purchase a cake directly from the restaurant. As it was a 6 course meal and only 2 diners, it would have been too much -  passed that option and requested for a simple “Happy Birthday” to be written on the dessert plate. It was unfortunate that the staff had forgotten to do so, which is surprising considering that I’d called way in advanced and the staff had told me this was noted.

Experience was good but would have been completed if the staff had not forgotten it was a birthday celebration.

Lovely place! This is my second time here after many years. I love the aquarium!! It was nice to see the stingray and mantra ray swimming around while having our meal. We spent about 3 hours+ there and ordered the 6 course meal. In between our meal, they gave a lot of complimentary on the house extras so I feel the 6 course is pretty worth it. I really like their bread and butter.

An extraordinary dining experience for two with the 8-course menu while surrounded by a mesmerizing underwater view. Watching marine life like stingrays and hammerhead sharks swim by adds a magical touch to the meal. The dishes were …

Our anniversary celebration here was perfect! We were captivated by the stunning views, which kept changing, like the delightful smiling stingray – we simply couldn't get enough of them. We also deeply appreciated the attentive and lovely staff and chef who thoughtfully accommodated my partner's nut allergy..

The online reservation process was smooth and seamless. Clear directions were given on how to get to the restaurant. We took the buggy service from Hotel Michael and we arrived at the restaurant within 5 mins. …

The hostess is super friendly. Get to seat at a good place where the Manta Ray keep swimming by.

Give 4 stars instead of the 5 because of the last course dessert Citro Bergamot Tarte. The dessert was to sour to finish. Didn't manage to finish it off. I wonder if anyone finish off.

Other then that the rest is good !!

I rolled into Ocean Restaurant excited for an eight-course tasting and it was a real rollercoaster.

Food

The seafood all felt par-boiled rather than wok-seared, so if you’re after that big, smoky Asian punch, you might leave a little underwhelmed.

Most of the sauces were spot-on (I’m still dreaming of that miso-ginger), but the pea purée? One taste and my tongue threw in the towel. 😰

Apple crumble dessert: Cute concept, but they cranked the apple flavor so high it drowned out everything else.

Ambience

Mid-meal, it felt like an untightened tap dripped straight onto my wife’s dress—definitely not what you pay for in “elegant dining.” (air con)

A squad of drain flies crashed our party, buzzing around and even landing in the bread basket. Even after they tried to shoo them off, our little guests refused to leave.

Service
Huge props to service staff May for saving the night:

Table Rescue – Spotted the leak and moved us to drier ground.

Dish Hype – Walked us through each course like a personal hype squad.

Photo Assist – Snapped our shots so we didn’t end up looking like lost tourists.

Would I go back?
Maybe—but only if service staff May is on shift, they swap out that pea purée, dial down the apple in the crumble, and banish the flies.

I had the pleasure of dining at Ocean Restaurant at Resort World Sentosa, and it was an unforgettable experience!
The ambiance is both elegant and serene, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that complements the marine theme.
The menu is a culinary journey, showcasing a blend of fresh seafood and innovative flavors. I opted for the six courses menu, which featured beautifully presented dishes. Each course was a delight, bursting with flavor and artistry. Notable highlights included the seared scallops—cooked to perfection.
The service was impeccable; the staff were knowledgeable and attentive, special recognition to Ms. WINNIE LIEW who is always ensuring that every detail of our dining experience was flawless.

Overall, Ocean Restaurant offers not just a meal, but a memorable experience that combines exquisite cuisine with breathtaking views of marine life.

We had an unforgettable dining experience while celebrating our anniversary at Ocean Restaurant.

The ambiance was stunning and opulent, but what truly made our dining experience special was the incredible staff. Rona went above and beyond to make us feel celebrated, and Jackie was attentive, warm, and offered thoughtful recommendations that enhanced our meal. The sommelier, Marcus, and Jessica, were all very friendly. They added personalized touches that made our celebration even more extraordinary. Jessica even arranged our buggy ride and ensured everything went smoothly. The team made sure everything was perfect—kudos to them for their outstanding service!

As a food critic might say, the dishes were not your typical fare but offered a unique and creative twist. The flavors were well-balanced and delicious, making the experience both adventurous and enjoyable.

One of the most magical aspects was dining beside the massive aquarium, filled with fascinating marine life. Watching the graceful movements of the sea creatures while enjoying our meal was truly spectacular—it felt like being immersed in an underwater paradise.

The majestic atmosphere, paired with delicious food and outstanding service, made our anniversary celebration impeccable. We couldn’t have asked for a better one!

We highly recommend Ocean Restaurant for anyone seeking an extraordinary dining experience!

As a seafood lover and aquarium enthusiast, I had been looking forward to this experience after CATCORA more than 10 years ago.

The moment I stepped into the restaurant, I was captivated by the stunning panoramic view of the S.E.A. Aquarium. Watching the marine life swim gracefully while enjoying my meal was truly mesmerizing.

We ordered a 8-course dinner set(288$) with wine pairing(+198).

While the restaurant undoubtedly boasts some of the freshest seafood in Singapore, excessive use of squid ink sauces might not be ideal for a first date.

The deep, inky hue can leave your lips and teeth stained, making it a less-than-romantic affair.
However, if you're willing to overlook the potential cosmetic mishap, the seafood itself is truly exceptional.

The freshness is a testament to the restaurant's commitment to sourcing the finest ingredients and showcasing them in their natural state. It seems the head chef also has some sort of special obsession with the use of foams with it on several dishes.

Service was impeccable. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and made excellent recommendations. He was attentive and ensured that our dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish.

Overall, my dinner at Ocean Restaurant was pleasant. I do recommend it to anyone with a budget to try this place when visiting Singapore or for a special occasion(just not first few dates).

The menu has alot of food options. We ordered Sweet & Sour Pork Rice with an added egg and a Seafood Hor Fun. Sweet and Sour Pork Rice was really yummy. Pork pieces were freshly fried and crispy, the sauce was tasty and the egg was fried perfectly with the egg white and yolk both being runny and soft while its sides were crispy. Rice was nicely cooked and complemented the pork well. The Hor Fun was generously supplied with seafood - every spoonful would come with a piece of seafood. Cooked well with wok hey taste and the noodles were thinner and usual, making it easier to bite and the noodles were well coated and cooked evenly.

There are plenty of drink options as well. DIY from the fridges and comes with chilled cup. No ice provided. They have a good selection of beer also (incl China beer that goes well with their grilled skewers).

Overall, the food is well cooked, tasty, affordable. Would definitely visit again. Great option along that stretch other than prata, pub grub or nasi lemak.
